previewPlan.name: Go Beyond FTP: Tempo
previewPlan.description:
**Unlock your full potential to TEMPO:**

​

Build your stamina for sustained high-intensity efforts in long climbs and **TEMPO** by boosting your maximal aerobic power.

prospects.name: Joyride
prospects.description:
This session is all about Max Aerobic Power (MAP), also known as VO2 max training. MAP refers to the maximum rate of oxygen delivery and uptake by your body and is an important metric in the world of endurance sports. During this 30-minute session, you’ll be doing five MAP targeted intervals. The first is 3 minutes long, and each successive interval gets 30 seconds shorter until you end with a final effort of “just” 60 seconds. The structure of each interval varies to keep you on your toes, some with increases in power, some with decreases.

​

The cadence targets for this session are generally going to be a little higher than “comfortable” for most people – and for a very specific reason. We want to maximize the cardiovascular stress of this session rather than loading up your muscular system. But don’t worry, you’ll still feel it in your muscles – likely all of them.

​

To keep the total stress of this shorter session fairly high, you’re going to have _just enough_ recovery between each effort, but nothing extra – so don’t let the short duration fool you into thinking this is going to be easy. On the contrary, you might find this to be one of the more challenging—and productive—sessions in our library. Now, go out there and get that stage win!

prospects.name: MAP Progression 1: 2 Sets 8 x 30/15
prospects.description:
As the title suggests, this is the first of a series of workouts designed to help you accumulate time at MAP. In simple terms, this session is a classic tabata style workout where the 'work' interval is twice the length of the 'recovery' intervals. As the first in this MAP progression series you have 2 sets of 8 intervals that are 30 seconds long with 15 seconds of recovery in between.

​

This workout is a great intro into higher intensity sessions and should get your heart rate up but not overload you.

How will this session progress with future NoVids? Each new session will add more repeats, or more sets or both. By the 5th level you'll be up to 3 sets of 14 repeats.

​

Find out more about how to apply these sessions to your training [here](https://wahoox.forum.wahoofitness.com/t/new-novids-in-systm/22251).

prospects.name: The Rookie
prospects.description:
These race simulations steadily get harder and harder as the workout progresses, so don’t be too keen to increase the intensity after the first 10-minute effort if it felt “too easy.” Just wait. The pain will come.

​

During each interval, you'll be ducking and diving right under and over threshold, forcing your body to churn through all the metabolites you're producing (that's the nasty stuff that the Painsuckers love so much). This is one of the best ways to improve your FTP without really overloading your system with too much training stress.

​

The final two intervals allow you to really charge over your threshold to unleash whatever power you have left in your legs. These two all-out bursts of power, in addition to the constant surges above threshold, means this session works your Anaerobic Capacity more than some of the other FTP-focused sessions.

prospects.name: Core & Hip Mobility A
prospects.description:
This module is a ground-based session designed to improve mobility through your hips and low back while activating and integrating muscles that are key to core stability. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Inchworm
- Pigeon Stretch
- Hip Bridge w/Knee Squeeze
- Marching Hip Bridge
- Back Extension w/Arms Overhead
- Quadruped w/Alt. Leg/Arm
- Bird Dog
- Kneeling Pelvic Tilt

prospects.name: [BETA] Understanding 4DP pt.2: Anaerobic Capacity -AC (The Knowledge Podcast)
prospects.description:
[**Beta Feedback Thread**](https://forum.wahooligan.com/t/the-knowledge-workouts-beta/24072)

​

If you’ve done the 1-minute test at the end of our 4DP fitness test, Full Frontal, you know what digging deep into your Anaerobic Capacity feels like. And you can think of your Anaerobic Capacity — your ability to attack, surge, close gaps…and do those things over and over — like a battery. The bigger it is, and the faster you can recharge it, the faster and more powerful you will be. Neal and Mac explain what AC is about, why you need more of it, and which of the sessions in SYSTM will help you get it.

​

The Knowledge podcast by Wahoo is a science-based podcast focused on providing training information for endurance athletes. Hosted by sports scientists, it delves into various training topics, offering actionable insights and key takeaways.

[**Find out more**](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes)

prospects.name: Provence: Dentelles de Montmirail
prospects.description:
It might only be 16k long, but there's a lot packed in. Starting in the wine town of Beaumes-de-Venise, you'll head out on a rolling route that just demands a high effort and lots of little sprints. A solid Vo2 effort late in the ride makes this a fantastic workout, but it's the local culture and scenery that will really captivate you. From charming old villages, the smell of fresh bread, sing-a-longs, amazing caves, and vineyards you'll hardly have time to think about how hard you're working.

​

[**Route on Strava**](https://www.strava.com/activities/3929264625)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: MAP Progression 2: 2 Sets 11 x 30/15
prospects.description:
As the title suggests, this is the second of a series of workouts designed to help you accumulate time at MAP. In simple terms, this session is a classic tabata style workout where the 'work' interval is twice the length of the 'recovery' intervals. As the second in this MAP progression series you have 2 sets of 11 intervals that are 30 seconds long with 15 seconds of recovery in between.

​

This workout is a great intro into higher intensity sessions and should get your heart rate up but not overload you.

How will this session progress with future NoVids? Each new session will add more repeats, or more sets or both. By the 5th level you'll be up to 3 sets of 14 repeats.

​

Find out more about how to apply these sessions to your training [here](https://wahoox.forum.wahoofitness.com/t/new-novids-in-systm/22251).

prospects.name: Nine Hammers
prospects.description:
Sometimes you're the hammer. Sometimes you're the nail. And sometimes, you're getting both hammered and nailed. With a series of nine different intervals, all at or above threshold, this is one of the best Maximal Aerobic Power / VO2 sessions in The Sufferfest library. It isn’t just the total amount of time spent above threshold, though.

​

This workout takes the training stress up a notch by giving you barely enough time to recover from the previous hammer before the next one falls. This ensures your Anaerobic Capacity gets a little boost as well.

prospects.name: Core Focus 01
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve ALL of the muscles that make up your core? You’ve come to the right place. The Core Focus series builds up everything from your hip to your shoulders - front, back, and side._

​

To do this, we’ll take you through a variety of contraction types: eccentric (lengthening), concentric (shortening), and isometric (holding a position). The result? Improved core strength, stability, and endurance. You'll find exercises that carry over into other areas of your body, but all of the moves have a significant impact on your core. Level 1 is ideal for very beginners. Even then, you may find some of these moves challenging if you have never attempted them. That’s ok, take your time and pause the video if you need. Soon you’ll be on your way to mastering your core potential. In addition to a mat, you'll need some open wall space for this routine.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Side Bend w/ Arms Overhead
- Downward Dog
- Quadruped T-Spine Rotation
- Back Extension w/ opp arm & leg raise
- Hamstring Hip Bridge
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Quadruped w/ alternating arm raise
- Quad w/ leg raises
- Low Side Plank w/ toe-tap front/back
- High Side Plank w/ Hold
- Quad Toes w/ Alternate Arm Raise
- Quadruped Pull In & Hold
- Quadruped Push Out & Hold
- Bird Dogs
- Back Extension with Hold
- Child's Pose

prospects.name: Revolver
prospects.description:
The simple idea of going hard for one minute and then easy for one minute, and then repeating, has been around since whatever evil genius realized that intervals were the best way to train. There is a reason this simple session has stuck around: it works.

​

30 seconds into a high-intensity effort, enough of your anaerobic energy sources have been depleted that your body shifts to producing that power aerobically. Follow that effort with only 60 seconds of recovery, and your body hasn’t fully replenished those anaerobic stores, meaning it will have to produce that power aerobically after just 25 seconds.

​

With a total of just 15 (cough, cough) efforts, you will have not only forced your body to replenish its Anaerobic Capacity (AC) over and over, but you've just spent several minutes producing lots of power with lots of oxygen. That combination ensures this session hits both your Maximal Aerobic Power (MAP) and AC with just the right stress they need to start increasing.

​

_Revolver has recently been remastered (Aug '22) to include all new footage and music. The workout has a longer warm-up than previous editions._

prospects.name: MAP Progression 3: 3 Sets 8 x 30/15
prospects.description:
As the title suggests, this is the third of a series of workouts designed to help you accumulate time at MAP. In simple terms, this session is a classic tabata style workout where the 'work' interval is twice the length of the 'recovery' intervals. As the third in this MAP progression series you have 3 sets of 8 intervals that are 30 seconds long with 15 seconds of recovery in between.

​

How will this session progress with future NoVids? Each new session will add more repeats, or more sets or both. By the 5th level you'll be up to 3 sets of 14 repeats.

​

Find out more about how to apply these sessions to your training [here](https://wahoox.forum.wahoofitness.com/t/new-novids-in-systm/22251).

prospects.name: Tasmania: Cygnet Coast Road
prospects.description:
The setting might be one of stunning tranquility, but this workout certainly isn't. We're down in far, far Southern Tasmania for a ride along one of the most stunning - but little known - roads in the region. Starting in the hamlet of Cradoc, we head south along the peninsula to the village of Cygnet. It's a rolling road with countless little 'kickers' that we're going to hit at maximum intensity in order to simulate a race or hard group ride. Along the way, we'll pop in to visit some of the most interesting characters who call this area home: a winemaker, an artist, and the founder of a famous cooking school.

​

[Route on Strava](https://www.strava.com/routes/2927502558987635926)

​

_About your host: Who better to show you around Tasmania than Nicole Frain? Raised in the north of the island, and currently living just outside Hobart, Nicole knows all the best places to spend your time on and off the bike. Known for her aggressive racing, the Parkhotel-Valkenberg professional won the 2022 Australian Elite Road Race Championship with a late attack and also finished second overall at the 2022 Tour Down Under. Good luck staying with her as she takes you through these workouts!_

​

Featured in this video:

[Farmhouse Kitchen](https://www.thefarmhousekitchen-tas.com/)

[Sailor Seeks Horse](https://sailorseekshorse.com.au/)

[Matt Calvert](https://mattcalvert.com.au/)

prospects.name: Basic Yoga Poses
prospects.description: Throughout the SYSTM yoga program there are several basic, foundational moves that form the core of the routines. This session takes you through those moves in detail so you can master them and their more difficult variations.

prospects.name: Cadence Builds
prospects.description:
One of the best sessions for neuromuscular training, this drill asks you to progressively build from a cadence of 90 RPM to your MAX over 30 seconds, recover, and repeat several times. Cadence builds improve how you recruit your leg, gluteal, and core muscles throughout your pedal stroke by progressing to your maximal cadence. By reaching your highest cadence possible, you are training the 'on/off' switch in each muscle group to not only work faster but to have less overlap with your other muscle groups. This session trains your hamstring muscles to 'turn off' when your quads 'turn on' and vice-versa, resulting in a more efficient pedal stroke at both high and low cadences.

​

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to The Knowledge podcast, by Wahoo Sports Science - The Benefits of High Cadence Training: [https://wahoosystm.com/BenefitsofHighCadence](https://wahoosystm.com/BenefitsofHighCadence)

prospects.name: Adventure For All 2023
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2023): As one of Wahoo's close partners, Adventure For All's mission is to guide individuals with exceptionalities through life-changing adventures while creating innovative educational practices that ignite a shift in societal belief systems.Together we will guide individuals with exceptionalities through life-changing adventures while creating innovative educational practices that ignite a shift in societal belief systems.

​

**Experience the Adirondacks:**

Join four exceptional athletes in the Adirondack mountains on the adventure of a lifetime. These athletes challenge themselves, conquer fears, and demonstrate their ability to overcome obstacles, proving to themselves and the world they can achieve anything.

​

**Finish:**

Witness Riley, a remarkable young man with Autism and Tourette's, as he pedals beyond expectations to conquer the challenging 31+ mile Big Sugar gravel bike race. This isn't just a story about cycling; it's a journey of courage, hope, and the shattering barriers. With the unwavering support of his mom and the dedicated team at Adventure For All, Riley's adventure redefines what's possible, turning every pedal stroke into a victory for him and everyone who believed in his endless potential.

​

[**Find out more about Adventure For All**](https://adventureforall.org/)

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: Scratches
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2023): Scratches is not a film about ending a race, as much as it is about the start of it all—the origin of cycling adventures for someone like Manu. This journey, in many ways, parallels the experiences of numerous individuals. Why do we need this kind of riding? Why do we crave this adventure? Rather than providing a generic answer, the film delves into Manu’s relationship with cycling as a tool for freedom, exploration, meditation, and perhaps even therapy in some ways. The film unfolds in the Kirghiz mountains during the Silk Road Mountain Race in 2023, where Manu crashed and had to scratch. It then retraces its steps back in time and travels to other lands. Initially, the film was intended to be a video race recap, but it evolved into a love letter to freedom and movement. Eventually, it underwent another transformation, and Scratches is the result of a constantly evolving process in that regard.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.name: Shoulder & Upper Back Mobility A
prospects.description:
This session is designed to improve motion through your shoulders and upper back as well as activate muscles that are key for upper body stability and posture. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality range of motion. Do not move into pain. If you have tingling or numbness from any of these movements stop and consult a medical professional. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Forward Shoulder Rolls
- Backward Shoulder Rolls
- Standing T-Spine Rotation
- Standing Scapular Retraction
- Wall Angels
- Scapular Depression
- Quadruped w/Alt. Arm Raise
- Quadruped w/Push Out
- Quadruped w/Pull In
- Downward Dog
